title: Print, "Two Designs for Vase-Like Ornaments", 1740
inscribed: On plate, lower left: F.X. Haberman, inv. et del.; lower center: No. 143.; lower right: Joh. Georg Hertel, exc. Aug. 1. V.; lower left (vertical): 27
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
dimensions:
Platemark: 30.5 x 20.4 cm (12 x 8 1/16 in.)
Sheet: 40.7 x 23.3 cm (16 x 9 3/16 in.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Two robust designs for vase-like objects decorated with naturalistic motifs: leaves, garlands of flowers, and cartouches. S-scrolls and c-scrolls create movement on the surface of the vases. Two fragments are placed between the vases.
